> [!CAUTION]
> **Do not manually modify the contents of this directory**.
> All files in this directory are automatically maintained.
> They can be managed through the [`user/discussion.yaml`](.control/user/discussion.yaml)
> configuration file of the repository's [control center](.control).

abstract: Welcome to PyPackIT Test1 powered by PyPackIT. Replace this text with a short abstract of PyPackIT Test1, describing its purpose and main feature. By default, this text is displayed on the repository's main README file, on the homepage of the project's website, on the project's PyPI and TestPyPI pages, and on the package's main docstring. Like all other entries in the repository's control center, this text can also contain dynamic references to other entries, using the ${‎{ json-path.to.value }}$ syntax. By default, the first occurrence of the name of the project in this text is styled as strong and linked to the project's website.

chore.type_description: Perform general maintenance and housekeeping activities.

ci.type_description: Change Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines.

docs_change.type_description: Introduce backward-incompatible (breaking) changes in ${{ name }} documentation and publish a new post-release.

docs_feat.type_description: Add backward-compatible features to ${{ name }} documentation and publish a new post-release.

docs_fix.type_description: Fix bugs in ${{ name }} documentation and publish a new post-release.

pkg_api_change.type_description: Introduce backward-incompatible (breaking) changes in PyPackIT-Test1's API and publish a new major release.

pkg_api_feat.type_description: Add backward-compatible features to PyPackIT-Test1's API and publish a new minor release.

pkg_api_fix.type_description: Fix bugs in PyPackIT-Test1's API and publish a new patch release.

pkg_build_change.type_description: Introduce backward-incompatible (breaking) changes in PyPackIT-Test1's build system and publish a new major release.

body.content: Welcome to the PyPackIT Test1 community! We are excited to have you here, and grateful that you are considering contributing. PyPackIT Test1 is a free and open-source project that evolves with the needs of its users, and can only grow through the help of great members like you.
To keep all our project documentation organized and easy to find, the complete contribution guide is hosted on our website.

highlights.description: Description of the first key feature of PyPackIT Test1. By default, these highlights are displayed on the repository's main README file, on the homepage of the project's website, and on the project's PyPI and TestPyPI pages.
highlights.title: First Key Feature

highlights.description: Description of the second key feature of PyPackIT Test1. For aesthetic reasons, it is recommended to keep the descriptions of all items in this list approximately the same length.
highlights.title: Second Key Feature

highlights.description: Description of the third key feature of PyPackIT Test1. You can add as many keynotes as you want. However, in order to keep the READMEs clean and tidy, it is recommended to keep the number of keynotes between 3 and 7.
highlights.title: Third Key Feature

1. **`pip`**: Run `pip freeze > requirements.txt` in your terminal within the environment, and copy the contents of the generated `requirements.txt` file here.
2. **`conda`**: Run `conda env export > environment.yml` in your terminal within the environment (or alternatively `conda env export -n {YOUR_ENVIRONMENT_NAME} > environment.yml`), and copy the contents of the generated `environment.yml` file here.

attributes.value:
### ⚠️ Verifying the Bug

Before submitting a report, please make sure that you are following our Bug Report Guidelines to verify that:

-

The issue you are experiencing is in fact a bug, and not a documented expected behavior.

-

The bug is reproducible in the latest version of the release, and has not yet been reported.

### ⚠️ Verifying the Request

Before submitting a report, please make sure that you are following our Change Request Guidelines to verify that:

-

Your request is for a backward-incompatible change, and not a new feature, improvement, or bug fix.

-

The request is not implemented in the latest version of the release, and has not yet been filed.

### ⚠️ Verifying the Request

Before submitting a report, please make sure that you are following our Feature Request Guidelines to verify that:

-

Your request is for a backward-compatible change, and not a breaking change or a bug fix.

-

The request is not implemented in the latest version of the release, and has not yet been filed.

Please provide a [test case](https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/getting-started.html) that demonstrates the bug:
- In the `test` function below, replace the value of `command` with the exact command that is causing the problem.
- Replace the value of `expected_return_code` with the expected return code of the command.
- Replace the value of `expected_output` with the expected output of the command. Use [`assert` statements](https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/how-to/assert.html) to specify the expected results.

attributes.value:
import subprocess


def test():
    command = ""
    expected_return_code = 0
    expected_output = b""

    result = subprocess.run(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True)
    assert result.returncode == expected_return_code
    assert result.stdout == expected_output

attributes.value:
import subprocess


def test():
    command = ""
    expected_return_code = 0
    expected_output = b""

    result = subprocess.run(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True)
    assert result.returncode == expected_return_code
    assert result.stdout == expected_output

myst.notes:
This is added as a dependency and not an extension
because the MyST-NB extension (a superset of MyST-Parser) is used as an extension,
which already includes MyST-Parser.
However, here we specifically include MyST-Parser to ensure the correct version is installed.
